descript.abstract: Aquastat is the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) global information system of water and agriculture developed by the Land and Water Development Division of FAO. Aquastat provides users with comprehensive information on the state of agricultural water management across the world, with emphasis on developing countries and countries in transition. Aquastat consists of a database which provides information on water and agriculture by countries organized by categories, country profiles with standardized text by country and summary tables; maps and GIS with spatial data on water and irrigation. The most recent available information is given for land use, water resources, land under irrigation, source of irrigation water, irrigated crops and intensification, population, water use, irrigation technique, environment and drainage.
descript.purpose: The purpose of Aquastat is to provide a clear picture of the situation of rural water resources management on a country basis, with emphasis on irrigation, and featuring major characteristics, trends, constraints and perspectives; to help support continental and regional analyses by providing systematic, up-to-date and reliable information on water for agriculture and rural development, and to serve as a tool for large-scale planning and forecasting.
descript.supplinf: Information was obtained from http://www.fao.org/ag/agl/aglw/aquastat/main/index.htm (previous geoform was 'Database')

spdom.descgeog: Focuses on the countries of the world including developing countries and excluding Europe, the United States.

dataqual.complete: Aquastat contains a wide range of information. The completeness depends upon the specific component. The database part of Aquastat provides the most recent available information, i.e. no time-series are yet available, for the following categories: population, water use, irrigation techniques, environment, drainage. The country profiles are based on the most recent information, which was available when the profile was written. They will be updated every five to ten years. For the most recent reliable data on water resources and their use in agriculture, reference is made to the Aquastat database. The country profiles are written for the countries listed in the keyword section of this report. Maps and GIS feature, global maps of irrigated areas, global maps, a database on African dams, and African maps. These may vary in completeness.

overview.eaover: Entity - freshwater availability; Attributes - database, country profiles, regional overviews, maps and GIS, institutions, water resources, agricultural water use, documents, links, glossary, land use, water resources, land under irrigation, source of irrigation water, irrigated crops and intensification, population, water use, irrigation, techniques, environment, drainage

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Food and Agriculture Organization, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a Food and Agriculture Organization server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The Food and Agriculture Organization shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
